alert.note: Alert for Indian River; Northern Brevard County; Okeechobee; Osceola; Southern Brevard County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 11:44AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Okeechobee, western Indian River, Brevard and eastern Osceola Counties through 1215 PM EST... At 1143 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Kennedy Space Center to near Lake Marian and into Highlands County. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Melbourne, Titusville, Rockledge and Cocoa. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EST for east central Florida.

area.areaDesc: Indian River; Northern Brevard County; Okeechobee; Osceola; Southern Brevard County
